result.execSummary:
The defendant William J Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

from DA L.M. to Atty Anne Renc with attached supporting documentation  - copy **original filed in 14CF247

Defendant William J Scott in court with attorney Anne Renc. Defendant William J Scott in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:34 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 
All files heard: 14CF247, 15CF12, 15CF47, 15CF48

Court and both counsel have received the PSI. 
Atty Molepske states correction.  Makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  
14CF247 Count 1 - 
10 years in the Wisconsin State Prison system with 5 years initial confinement followed by 5 years extended supervision, concurrent to all other sentences. 
Not eligible for CIP but eligible for SAP after 3 1/2 years. 
188 days credit. 

15CF12 Count 1 - 
10 years in the Wisconsin State Prison system with 5 years initial confinement followed by 5 years extended supervision, concurrent to all other sentences. 


15CF12 Count 2 - 
10 years in the Wisconsin State Prison system with 5 years initial confinement followed by 5 years extended supervision, concurrent to all other sentences. 
Eligible for SAP after 3 1/2 years.
182 days.

15CF47 Count 1 - 
10 years in the Wisconsin State Prison system with 5 years initial confinement followed by 5 years extended supervision, concurrent to all other sentences. 


15CF47  Count 2 - 
10 years in the Wisconsin State Prison system with 5 years initial confinement followed by 5 years extended supervision, concurrent with all other sentences. 
182 days credit.
Eligible for SAP after 3 1/2 years.

15CF48  Count 1 -
4 years in the Wisconsin State Prison system with 2 years initial confinement followed by 2 years extended supervision, concurrent with all other sentences. 
182 days credit.
SAP not applicable. 

ON EACH COUNT: Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Must submit a DNA sample. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Get all prescriptions from 1 pharmacy. 
Sign a release so that the agent can get all information re: medications he is on. 
Must provide agent with list of medications. 
Must comply with all Aftercare treatment programming once he is released from prison. 
Follow all treatment recommendations from treatment he received while confined.
Comply with any assessment, treatment, counseling or programming deemed appropriate by DOC. 
No contact with individuals who are associated with the unlawful use of controlled substances. 
Obtain and maintain fulltime employment, go to school fulltime or a combination thereof. 
Pay all costs and surcharges within the 1st year of supervision.
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Only have an AODA assessment if he receives absolutely no treatment in the prison system. 

Atty Molepske makes statements re: AODA condition. 
Atty Renc makes statements re: no restitution having been requested. 

Court provides a copy of the Written Explanation of Determinate Sentences to the defendant.  Advises of post-conviction. 

Atty Molepske makes statements re: restitution and buy money. 

BY THE COURT:  
Court allows the State 30 days to determine restitution/buy money costs. 
Defense will have 30 days to reply to that request. 
(Clerk clarifies restitution should be on 14CF247, 15CF12 & 15CF47 only)

Defendant William J Scott in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant William J Scott in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF247, 14CF452, 15CF12, 15CF47, 15CF48, 15CF84
9:05 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
  Indicates there will be uncharged read-ins as well. 

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF247 Count 1 - NO CONTEST
15CF12 Counts 1 & 2 - NO CONTEST
15CF47 Counts 1 & 2 - NO CONTEST
15CF48 Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty to the following:
14CF247 Count 1 
15CF12 Counts 1 & 2 
15CF47 Counts 1 & 2
15CF48 Count 1 
Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Convictions this date.

14CF452 is dismissed and read-in. 
15CF12 Count 3 is dismissed and read-in. 
15CF48 Count 2 is dismissed and read-in. 
15CF84 is dismissed and read-in. 
Uncharged read-in to be provided to defense in writing.  That is to be done before the sentencing. 


Court orders a PSI. 
PSI to be completed by 12/11/2015 with copies forwarded to counsel so they can prepare for sentencing. 
Court orders that all bonds are revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant William J Scott in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Defendant William J Scott in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 14CF247, 14CF452, 15CF12, 15CF47, 15CF48, 15CF84

Atty Molepske makes statements.  Defendant will not be entering a plea. 
Atty Halverson indicates the defendant has some questions. 

2:07 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond & Conditions of Bond are continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for William J Scott
Current: 119 W North St, Plainfield, WI 54966-9289 United States  (Effective: 07-27-2015)
Prior: 7771 County Road A, Almond, WI 54909 United States

ADDRESS INFO for William J Scott
Current: 7771 County Road A, Almond, WI 54909 United States  (Effective: 07-22-2015)
Prior: 7771 Cty Tk A, Almond, WI 54909

$15,000 cash bond to cover all files 14CF247, 14CF452, 15CF12, 15CF47, 15CF48, 15CF84.   If posts bond, also maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.  Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.

1:35 p.m. Prosecuting Atty Louis J. Molepske appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant William J Scott appeared by video. Cases # 14CF247, 14CF452, 15CF12, 15CF47, 15CF48, 15CF84.  Warrants quashed.
Court questions reasons for not appearing prior for court.  DA requests $25,000 cash bond.

BTC: $15,000 cash bond to cover all files 14CF247, 14CF452, 15CF12, 15CF47, 15CF48, 15CF84.   If posts bond, also maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.  Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant did not appear. Attorney Anne Renc in court. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:20 a.m.  Court calls the case. 
Court reviews the file.  Received the Day Report assessment.  
Atty Renc did not expect her client here today. 
Atty Molepske requests bench warrants. 

BY THE COURT:  Bench warrants on all files.  Body Only.  Any bonds that have been posted in the files, are ordered forfeited.  

Atty Molepske makes statements re: Geographic restriction.  
Court agrees, because they are felony matters, they should not be limited to the State of Wisconsin in case he is picked up in another state.
Pre-trial conference on March 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.

3:25 pm. Defendant William J Scott in court with attorney Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
 Cases 15CF12, 15CF47 and 15CF48 are heard today.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered on all three files
Atty Renc request bond modification and reduction of Day report days.
ADA Knaapen objects and states the bond is appropriate.
BTC: Court Denies Motion to amend bond.  

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.

$500 cash bond (already posted in 15CF47): Comply with conditions in 14CF247 and any other outstanding bonds.
***02-26-15: The bond in 15CF48 also covers 15CF47.
Preliminary hearing on March 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant William J Scott in court with attorney Anne Renc. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases 15CF47 and 15CF48 are heard today.
Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaints and waived their readings.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties for each case.
Bond is set already on 15CF48.
BY THE COURT: Bond on 15CF48 applies as bond for 15CF47.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
